javelin.model.feat

Class Feat

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.feat.Feat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BullRush, Cleave, CombatExpertise, ExoticWeaponProficiency, GreatCleave, GreatFortitude, ImprovedFeint, ImprovedGrapple, ImprovedInitiative, ImprovedPreciseShot, ImprovedTrip, IronWill, LightningReflexes, Multiattack, MultiweaponFighting, PointBlankShot, PowerAttack, PreciseShot, RapidShot, Toughness, WeaponFinesse, WeaponFocus

    public abstract class Feat
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See the d20 SRD for more info. Would be nice to have Feat be a subclass of Upgrade, like Spell?
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Feat> ALL 
      java.lang.String name 
      boolean update
      If a feat needs updating, every time a Combatant is upgraded remove(Combatant) and add(Combatant) will be called so that there is a chance to update any statistics.

        If a feat needs updating, every time a Combatant is upgraded remove(Combatant) and add(Combatant) will be called so that there is a chance to update any statistics.

      • update

        public void update(Monster m)
        This is used by MonsterReader for when a monster source stat block needs to updated when it has a feat. Will be called multiple times if a monster has more than one feat of the same type.
        Parameters:
        monster - Original unique stat block to derive.
